title: Defective glial cells can push neurons toward Parkinson's disease

title_detail.value: Defective glial cells can push neurons toward Parkinson's disease

summary: A team of scientists have discovered that astrocytes are linked to the buildup of a toxic protein that is one the hallmarks of Parkinson's disease. The work suggests an important role for glial cells in Parkinson's disease and offers potential new targets for developing therapies.
